DataElement.preferredName: Computed Tomography X-Ray Diagnostic Imaging Chest Thoracic Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other abnormal finding of a chest X-ray or thoracic CT scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Computed Tomography X-Ray Diagnostic Imaging Chest Thoracic Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment involving a computed tomographic (CT; a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis) scan or X-ray (examination of any part of the body for diagnostic purposes by means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface) of the chest (the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm) or thoracic region.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :Examination of any part of the body for diagnostic purposes by means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface (such as photographic film).:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
Examination of any part of the body for diagnostic purposes by means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface (such as photographic film).
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:(thor-ASS-ik) Having to do with the chest.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
Having to do with the chest.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the involvement or extent of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
